main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over Selfridge Air Force Base on July 30, 1951, with an approximate speed of 28,000 miles per hour at high altitude.
interesting points: The object displayed an anomalous propagation, leading to several technical evaluations., No meteors or similar activities were reported at the time of the sighting., The object was detected at a distance of approximately 120 statute miles., The observations included a mix of radar data and visual confirmations., The conclusions considered various possibilities including balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomena.
witness description: 1st Lt. Robert K. Hall and radar station personnel
